metadata.title: CVE-2018-12373 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
dDecrypted S/MIME parts hidden with CSS or the plaintext HTML tag can leakplaintext when included in a HTML reply/forward. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 52.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.9.1+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
